programme.title: NFL Fantasy Live
programme.desc: Millions of NFL fans live in a fantasy world where survival depends on successfully navigating the twists and turns of a grueling season. After all, relying on a second-string quarterback or an untested wide receiver to come up big is usually foolhardy. Avoiding such predicaments takes plenty of preparation, and that's where "NFL Fantasy Live" comes into play. Host Marcas Grant provides the advice and analysis fantasy fans need to make winning lineup decisions. And being armed with the latest player updates, stats and trends goes a long way toward turning fantasies into championships.

After all, relying on a second-string quarterback or an untested wide receiver to come up big is usually foolhardy. Avoiding such predicaments takes plenty of preparation, and that's where "NFL Fantasy Live" comes into play. Host Marcas Grant provides the advice and analysis fantasy fans need to make winning lineup decisions. And being armed with the latest player updates, stats and trends goes a long way toward turning fantasies into championships.

programme.title: NFL Players: Second Acts
programme.desc: Former All-Pro Charles Tillman and former Pro Bowler Roman Harper break bread with NFL legends about how they've taken the passion, drive and dedication that made them stars on the gridiron and use it to achieve success in their post-playing careers.

programme.title: UFC Unfiltered
programme.desc: With a fight card to look forward to, Jim and Matt invite a pair of all-action veterans on to the show in Andre Fili and Roman Dolidze. A longtime friend of the show, Andre Fili returns to UFC Unfiltered for the first time as a father in one of his most thoughtful interviews yet. He talks about the life changes since welcoming his son Valor, how fatherhood has shifted his mindset inside and outside the cage, and his upcoming matchup with Christian Rodriguez. Then, Roman Dolidze joins ahead of his middleweight main event against Anthony Hernandez. He talks about rebounding from back-to-back losses to a strong win streak, what’s at stake this weekend, and what it is about the Georgian UFC fighters that keeps them so driven. Stick around as Matt and Jim make their picks for Saturday’s UFC Fight Night card!

programme.title: University of Texas Documentary
programme.desc: 3 years ago, pro lacrosse player Kyle Hartzell stepped on the campus of University of Texas at Austin as their new club lacrosse team head coach. Now they are a top MCLA program competing for championships. TLN went to Austin, TX during the most anticipated game of the Longhorn's season to uncover what makes their program so special.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 28 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! Jake Piseno joins the show! After Saturday's thrilling win over the Atlas, Jake describes just how special this Outlaws team is. Jake talks growing up in Syracuse, and why his favorite school growing up did not recruit him. The boys recap a crazy weekend in the PLL. Was Hoagie right about CJ Kirst? Doogs updates his MVP rankings. Is Coach Tierney on the hot seat? All of this and more on the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show!

programme.desc: A happily engaged couple find that temptation is everywhere. Will the consequences of their actions prove too much to handle?

programme.title: Being on Top
programme.desc: Four women, Sophia Simmons, Dylan Carter, Portia Fitzgerald and Bridgette Barlow, who at the height of their careers are leaders in their industry, discover that having it all is easier said than done. Faced with the challenge of wanting both a professional and a personal life, they realize that life at the top can at times be isolating, and require sacrificing the authority and control they've earned professionally.

programme.title: Torn
programme.desc: After discovering his wife is cheating on him, Delroy has to decide whether to pursue a promising new relationship, or fix his troubled marriage.

programme.title: Animal
programme.desc: In this crime-drama starring football superstar Jim Brown, a notorious gangster must reconcile his past in order to make a future for his criminally-minded son.

programme.title: Don't Touch if You Ain't Prayed
programme.desc: A 40-year-old virgin finally meets her soulmate, but when she sees the dark side of her dream man, she starts to question her faith.

programme.title: The Long Walk Home
programme.desc: Set in 1955 Montgomery, Alabama, this is the story of two women who must decide how they will respond to Martin Luther King Jr.’s call to boycott.

programme.title: Hav Faith
programme.desc: A man is elevated to lead a prominent church where issues arise between him, the son of the retiring bishop and a money-hungry real estate broker.

programme.desc: A magnetic playboy with bad intentions manages to date three sisters and uses his charms to convince their unsuspecting mother that he is a good guy.

programme.title: The Aftermath

programme.desc: A man who believed his life was going in the right direction is faced with a decision to either betray the woman he loves or turn on his best friend.

programme.title: Life of a King

programme.title: Klippers
programme.desc: After a loan shark hires a hitman to kill his ex-wife in exchange for debt erasal, the job quickly becomes more complicated than anyone thought.

programme.title: The Scroll: Revelations
programme.desc: THE SCROLL: Revelations is the natural progression of one of the most transcending documentaries ever created. It delves into the spiritual relevance of todays day and age at even furher levels. A feature length film created to help inspire everyday people through real life parables and narrations from recognizable spiritual figureheads. Presented as a series of short vignettes recorded in an intimate, close-cropped setting to engage the viewer as if he or she is soul seeking wisdom at the foot of a sage. Weaving the journey and anecdotes of some of the most prolific high profile ministers, evangelists and church leaders of the 21st Century, The Scroll took three years to complete, interviewing over 50 of the U.S.'s most progressive and revered Spiritual Leaders.

programme.title: The F.B.I.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: After hijackers steal $20 million in travelers' checks, their contact refuses to honor his promise of payment.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: A blind woman, taken hostage by a diamond thief, leaves clues that lead the FBI to the criminal's whereabouts.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: A young man hijacks an armored car using stolen explosives.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: A blackmailer searches for the man who entrapped him.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: The FBI tries to intercept a returned syndicate leader.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: The FBI investigates an elusive madman who attempts to kill three members of a college sorority.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: A recaptured prisoner helps save Agent Daniels’ life.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: Erskine's on the trail of an extorter who targets women.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: The FBI finds a shortage of over $100,000 in a bank’s books.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: Case file #70-68307-C - Joseph Cloud - Crime on Indian Reservation. Robert Blake guest stars.

programme.title: The F.B.I.
programme.desc: Modern investigative techniques and a shrewd hunch enable agent Lew Erskine to end a vicious killer's career.

programme.title: The F.B.I.

programme.title: The F.B.I.

programme.title: The F.B.I.

programme.title: The F.B.I.

programme.title: The F.B.I.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Arguing With Myself
programme.desc: Join Jeff and his outspoken felt pals: Walter, Peanut, José Jalapeño, Bubba J, and Sweet Daddy Dee for an evening of laughs and observations.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: I'm With Cupid
programme.desc: Ventriloquist and stand-up comedian Jeff Dunham performs an all-Valentine's Day-themed special.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Spark of Insanity
programme.desc: Jeff and his felt friends Walter, Melvin the Superhero Guy, Peanut, and others share their latest and greatest thoughts about our times.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Unhinged in Hollywood
programme.desc: The comedian and his puppets perform in the gorgeous Dolby Theatre, featuring hilarious sketches with surprise guests and lots of laughs.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special
programme.desc: The comic performs his well-known characters, including Achmed the Dead Terrorist.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Breakin' Out the Park
programme.desc: In this brutally honest stand-up performance, comedian Gary Owen confesses his hilarious history of growing up in and around trailer parks.

programme.title: Gary Owen: #DoinWhatIDo
programme.desc: The so-called “Funniest Serviceman in America” draws from his multiracial experience to lambast culture wars on social media and in his own home.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Black Famous
programme.desc: This last year has been unlike any other: COVID, lockdowns, and for Gary, it has also included a divorce and family insanity unlike any other; up until now, Gary hasn't been able to speak about what really happened.

programme.title: Steve Brown: Yeah, I Talk Like This
programme.desc: The high-pitched, high-energy voice of comedian Steve Brown is exactly how he talks in his first outrageous comedy set shot live in New York City.

programme.title: Tom Green Live
programme.desc: Following a similar format to a former online show that Tom Green hosted, "Tom Green Live" features the comic interviewing a guest from the entertainment world. Most of the hourlong episodes feature an interview with a single guest who gets grilled by Green and viewers, who are able to ask questions through video chat software. Each episode's initial broadcast airs live, allowing for a deeper look into the guest's life that might not be seen on other talk shows that edit interviews before they air. "Tom Green Live" also features less of a comedic atmosphere than his previous efforts.

programme.title: K-Von: Designer Muscles
programme.desc: Raised by a religious family in Las Vegas, half-Persian comedian K-von is an expert at removing a bad word from a joke while keeping it funny.

programme.title: Matt Braunger: Big Dumb Animal
programme.desc: Recorded live at The Bell House in Brooklyn, Big Dumb Animal is Matt Braunger at his best. He gives everyone a glimpse at what it's like to be a big dumb animal with an anger problem. He explores a vast array of topics ranging from the absurdity of a quiet Jägerbomb to his overly nice hometown of Portland, Oregon.

programme.title: Matt Braunger: Finally Live in Portland
programme.desc: The comic offers his insights on the world, and how his memorable mistakes have helped him gain a little perspective and maturity.

programme.title: Kevin Smith: Silent But Deadly Extended Edition
programme.desc: Kevin Smith is anything but quiet in this new comedy special that was recorded an hour before his heart attack in February; before he nearly died backstage, onstage he discusses his marriage, his kid and his work (or lack thereof).

programme.title: Tim Young: What World is This?
programme.desc: Tim headlines clubs all over North America.

programme.title: Dan Levy: Lion
programme.desc: Dan Levy works his way from a zebra to a lion in his new special. From his personal trainer texting him at 4am, to watching the movie "Frozen" with his kids at 6am, to even getting mugged in Beverly Hills, Dan is not afraid to talk about his exhausting life. He also shares his crippling HGTV addiction and what it's like raising a tiny Matthew McConaughey. Bonus: he'll also teach you how to cheat the massage parlor system.

programme.title: Tone Bell: Can't Cancel This
programme.desc: The comic offers his humorously uncompromising views on a more fair world, where Alaska is cold, student loans are paid, and jelly is free.

programme.title: Michael Ian Black: Very Famous
programme.desc: Michael Ian Black is very famous. Well, he’s not that famous, but he keeps telling the world he is. Filmed live in Philadelphia, Michael Ian Black’s sarcastic sense of humor comes to the stage in his latest comedy special.

programme.title: Michael Ian Black: Noted Expert
programme.desc: You know him from his hilarious work in sketch, TV, and film, but the comedian’s NYC special takes his deadpan delivery to a whole new level.

programme.title: Shawn Pelofsky: Stretch It Out
programme.desc: The unabashed comedienne stirs up laughs, with tales of growing up Jewish in Oklahoma, traveling to war zones, and sailing on gay male cruises.

programme.title: Billy Gardell: Halftime
programme.desc: The star of TV’s “Mike and Molly” returns to where the funny began for him, his hometown, Pittsburgh, in a live show saluting working-class America.

programme.title: ANT America's Ready
programme.desc: Ant takes on disparate topics ranging from faulty roofies to emergency landings and makes them all funny.

programme.title: Mary Mack: All Ages
programme.desc: Laugh along as the hilarious folk humorist with a flair for music discusses spending time in L.A., along with the weird advice she’s received.

programme.title: Laurie Kilmartin: Cis Woke Grief Slut
programme.desc: The veteran stand-up comic and longtime Conan writer pokes fun at single motherhood and the reasons trans women are CIS women’s best allies.

programme.title: Leah Rudick: Spiraling
programme.desc: Comedian and viral social media sensation Leah Rudick delves into marriage, family psychics, and anxiety attacks in the Cracker Barrel.

programme.title: Sierra Katow: Funt
programme.desc: Comedian Sierra Katow tackles her dumb career choice, online haters, and why anyone still has kids in her must-watch breakout special.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: Home for the Holidays
programme.desc: The comic performs in St. Louis, discussing Christmas as a child, feeling guilty on Mother's Day, Thanksgiving and Disneyland.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: I Could Eat - Part 1
programme.desc: Lavell Crawford is back and here to contemplate how "My 600 Pound Life" could go for 15 seasons and he was still underweight, the kind of racist you have to be to not take a free holiday, and explosive consequences in a Taco Bell bathroom.

programme.title: Cocoa Brown: Famous Enough
programme.desc: The comedian, actress and writer takes a live audience on her rollercoaster ride of dating and parenting during the pandemic—as only she can.

programme.title: Jasmine Ellis: Black Girl Panic
programme.desc: Jasmine Ellis reflects back at the formative experiences that formed her adulthood; to the delight of a full house in Austin, Texas, Ellis looks back at her parents, experiences in a mental hospital and interracial marriage as a Texan.

programme.title: Irene Bremis: Sweetie
programme.desc: Irene Bremis openly and unapologetically discusses her life on Staten Island, her Greek upbringing, and life’s hypocrisies and idiosyncrasies.

programme.title: Ester Steinberg: Schmear Campaign
programme.desc: Ester's new comedy special pushes boundaries with fearless humor, tackling her father's failed political career, a mommy makeover and the challenges of raising kids in the digital age.

programme.title: Erik Terrell: Live at Helium Comedy Club
programme.desc: Named one of Variety magazine’s “Comics to Watch,” here’s Erik Terrell in a hilarious stand-up set delivered at his “home club” in Philly.

programme.title: Colin Quinn: Unconstitutional
programme.desc: Comedian Colin Quinn analyzes the constitutional history of the United States.

programme.title: David Cross: Oh, Come On
programme.desc: David Cross takes viewers into the abyss of his thoughts in this stand-up set about couples’ colonics, waiting to bond with a newborn, and politics.

programme.title: Pete Lee: Tall, Dark, and Pleasant
programme.desc: A look into the comic's outrageous struggles with people-pleasing, relationships, sex, drugs and motion-sensor sinks.

programme.title: Phil Kopczynski: Live at the Spokane Comedy Club
programme.desc: The risqué comic talks about being a young father of kids, breast pumps that nearly short-circuit the house, inappropriately titled sex toys and more.

programme.title: Saul Trujillo: Yolanda
programme.desc: Does "Variety's top comic to watch" look like Selena's murderer? Find out why cruises are terrible and the homeless tent problem isn't the problem one thinks it is.

programme.title: Karen Morgan: Go Dawgs!
programme.desc: Former trial attorney Karen Morgan moved from the courtroom to comedy after being a finalist on Nickelodeon’s Search for the Funniest Mom in America.

programme.title: Leanne Morgan: So Yummy
programme.desc: The stand up comic discusses dogs, cheerleading camp, the struggles of being an empty nester, and joining Weight Watchers for the 7th time.

programme.title: Lachlan Patterson: Live From Venice Beach
programme.desc: Known for his scalpel-sharp wit, Lachlan Patterson shares his musings on make-up, mugshots, and more live from his home turf of Venice Beach.

programme.title: Ian Abramson: The Heist
programme.desc: Comedian Ian Abramson mixes performance art and stand-up to create one of history's most bananas comedy specials.

programme.title: Jay Mohr: Altamont
programme.desc: Comedian Jay Mohr tackles subjects from unexpected visitors, bringing up children to working with Chris Farley on SNL in his new stand-up special.

programme.title: Jay Mohr: American Treasure
programme.desc: The popular comedian tells deeply personal stories from his fascinating life and presents his famously funny celebrity impressions and observations.

programme.desc: Mark is stressed and exhausted from studying for an important entrance exam, so Darlene steps in to help, but her plan backfires.

programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.desc: Mark is anxious to get his driver's license; Darlene attempts to teach Mark to drive, but her frantic energy sends him running to Ben for help; Harris meets a new guy online.

programme.desc: When a relative passes away unexpectedly, the family must debate about who should gain custody of a jaded nephew, who is just shy of his 18th birthday.

programme.desc: Harris takes a stand on an issue that ruffles a few feathers in Darlene's new neighborhood.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

The young cooks must come up with an original recipe that is both healthy and presidential worthy, and the winner will receive a special once-in-a-lifetime opportunity! For the next challenge, Julie Bowen (“Modern Family”) steps into the MASTERCHEF kitchen to watch the kids make a dish in honor of their moms. Then, it’s up to the judges to decide which contestant will go home.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gives a masterclass on the summer pruning of fruit, gives advice on maintaining ponds and plants up a pot to give colour and interest to last into the autumn months. Adam Frost travels to Brodsworth Hall in South Yorkshire to meet a head gardener who has been set the challenge of restoring the gardens to their 19th century glory.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets going on a new planting project, gives advice on planting for east- and west- facing borders, starts reaping summer vegetables and sows seeds for autumn harvests. Sue Kent finds inspiration for her own garden when she explores the glorious Aberglasney Gardens in Wales, while Nick Bailey travels to Scotland to investigate a disease which is affecting trees and shrubs in both woodlands and gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow, keeping on top of seasonal maintenance as well as enjoying the plants of high summer. Adam Frost travels to Sissinghurst Castle Gardens to view a new area of the garden which was inspired by a visit to the Greek island of Delos, and in Berkshire we find out how one gardener keeps her garden full of interest in every season of the year. In West Sussex, we get tips on growing the perfect dahlia from a grower with over 50 years of experience.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Nick Bailey celebrate gardeners throughout the country who have created some truly unique gardens and made every space count. Carol meets a couple in Dorset whose garden is full of inspirational features.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty presents a masterclass on growing Mediterranean herbs, plants lily bulbs for summer scent, and in the vegetable garden, he begins to sow seeds for salad root crops. Carol Klein is in Devon, where she takes a close look at late summer planting combinations. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, there's a gardener whose passion for exotic plants and dahlias has taken over his family garden and spilled over onto his allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's all about plants for free at Longmeadow this week as Monty adds self-sown ornamental grass seedlings to the paradise garden. He also divides ferns for planting elsewhere in the garden. Advolly Richmond explores the history of lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles the perennial problem of what to grow in the shade beneath a tree, Carol Klein takes a look at the crocosmia and we meet a gardener in Derbyshire who has spent a lifetime growing and showing gladioli.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Arit Anderson and Frances Tophill visit Wakehurst, Kew's wild botanic garden in Sussex. They not only explore the gardens but also meet the gardeners, joining in on their planting projects and finding out more about the UK's largest conservation project, the Millenium Seed Bank.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes a special guest, the Duchess of Cornwall, to Longmeadow, where she shares her love of gardening. Nick Bailey visits Knoll Gardens and gives his tips on the tall perennials which give a burst of colour towards the end of the season.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty turns his attention to containers, planting them up for drama and summer colour in the jewel garden and showing us how to repot citrus plants. In Hampshire, Joe Swift meets the designer of an award-winning contemporary garden to explore the techniques and the plants she has used to seamlessly integrate both house and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As midsummer approaches, it's the perfect time for Monty to place succulents outside at Longmeadow, as well as planting out dahlias and tender vegetables. Carol Klein visits Trebah Garden in Cornwall, where she finds plants which can add early summer pazazz to our borders. Nick Bailey is at RHS Wisley to look at a variety of shrubs that can be used as alternatives to traditional box hedging. We travel to the seaside in Kent to meet a group of gardeners who have transformed a public space.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join Adam Frost in his garden, where he will be giving tips on laying turf, planting succulents and adding perennial plants to his kitchen garden to grow as cut flowers. Joe Swift travels to Marwood Hill Gardens in Devon to explore plants that thrive in moist conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost adds tall plants for shady conditions to his borders, demonstrates how to make a window box for growing vegetables and herbs, and gives his tips on how to grow plants successfully in peat-free compost.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty catches up with all his summer jobs in the border and the vegetable garden. Carol gets inspiration for planting combinations at Cothay Manor and Gardens, and Arit learns about slugs and snails.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to harvest and store potatoes. He also adds late summer colour to the cottage garden and prunes shrub roses. Carol Klein travels to Norfolk to meet Adrian Bloom, a member of a horticultural dynasty.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing before our eyes, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In preparation for late summer grass borders, he's filling the gaps that the diseased box hedges have left with grasses he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explores some of Longmeadow's late-summer highlights and propagates a range of favourite plants for next summer and we meet an artist who has created a very special roof garden where creativity and colour collide.

programme.title: Gardeners' World

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gives tips on lawn repair, grows some unusual vegetables and plants a seasonal container. Advolly Richmond brings us up to date in her history of lawns by exploring the trend for ever more sophisticated machinery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gives a masterclass on the summer pruning of fruit, gives advice on maintaining ponds and plants up a pot to give colour and interest to last into the autumn months. Adam Frost travels to Brodsworth Hall in South Yorkshire to meet a head gardener who has been set the challenge of restoring the gardens to their 19th century glory.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets going on a new planting project, gives advice on planting for east- and west- facing borders, starts reaping summer vegetables and sows seeds for autumn harvests. Sue Kent finds inspiration for her own garden when she explores the glorious Aberglasney Gardens in Wales, while Nick Bailey travels to Scotland to investigate a disease which is affecting trees and shrubs in both woodlands and gardens.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's May of 2022 and Mark Peterson is waterfowl hunting in Argentina. A year has passed since Mark conquered the North America Waterfowl Slam. During the off-season, and with Covid just a memory, his focus shifted to thoughts of South America and the waterfowl species that it holds. After a few months of research and talking with the experts at Worldwide Trophy Adventures, he laid out the plan to attempt the South America slam in 2022. With 20 species on the list, Mark is now hunting ducks below the equator as they migrate North to warmer weather. Enjoy this first installment of a 9 episode series that showcases his new quest for another single-season waterfowl slam.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Join Louisiana Celebrity Chef Jay Ducote (known as the guy who beat Bobby Flay), alongside Philadelphia's own Chef Brian Duffy (famous from Bar Rescue), as we pick up where we left off because this much flavor couldn't be contained in a single episode. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Chef Jean-Paul Bourgeois and the crew are back at it for season 3 of duck camp dinners. With a historically dry year in Louisiana, the team dodges marsh fires, hunts alligators, and prepares for the opening day of teal season.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Follow the DCD crew as they head North to hunt with duck call maker Brad Eldrige. Despite tough hunting conditions brought on by a historic drought in Louisiana, the crew is able to knock down a “Tensas Limit” of wood ducks, mallards, honkers, and squirrels.

programme.title: Captain's Log

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: From the ground up host Randy Birdsong will take you through the trials and tribulations of owning his first farm and grooming it to be one of the best whitetail hunting properties in the country

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys have a full camp for their first bow hunt of the season. With warm Temps and acorns falling everywhere, Nate throws a hail Mary on the last day on a buck they call "The Squiggly 8"

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: While Randy and Dustin are trying to get the farm ready for Fall plots and create new access trails, Cody is at the river living life to the fullest. Randy finally has had enough and is doing something about Cody’s lack of effort on the farm.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and Anna set out for a last minute fishing trip that runs a little late. They take a quick detour to the parent pick up line to get the kids from school, and head back out on the water to see what’s biting!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and George from Two Georges Marina battle the wind and tide on a tough day of fishing which leads Josh to fish another day, solely for revenge on the Sheepshead!

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Trophy Tautog are on the hit list for Nick and his crew as they ply the wrecks and reefs off New Jersey.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick visits the Crystal Coast of North Carolina to search out redfish and seatrout in the backwaters with Capt. Joe Tunstall and Capt. Chris Kimney.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! Year after year, Casa Vieja Lodge continues to impress with daily shots at sailfish, marlin, mahi, and tuna. Tag along on our 2nd annual group trip for a tropical fishing experience like no other!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Heavy hearts find comfort in cherished memories as the Local Knowledge crew mourns the loss of one of the greatest members of the fishing industry. Looking back on several of our episodes with our dear friend Dave Salazar, we celebrate the life of this amazing fishermen, family man, and visionary behind the world renowned Casa Vieja Lodge.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run west from Hawks Cay to fish the spring tarpon migration at the legendary Bahia Honda bridge.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head down to Key West to join Captain Brandon Cyr for some skinny water bonefishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor fish the Lower Keys with Captain Brandon Cyr for baby tarpon in the mangroves.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell fishing out of Hawks Cay for some grouper and tarpon action in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell brings some game changing technology along as he joins Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor for some nighttime tarpon fishing at the Long Key Bridge.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Sam Milazzo to find the elusive daytime Swordfish but run into some great Dolphin fishing on the way.

programme.title: Captain's Log

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With seven seasons down, the Local Knowledge crew is looking forward to another year of fish, people, and places, but first Ali and Rush take a look back at what made season 7 a year to remember. From wade fishing Texas for Redfish to making it back to the Baja groupers that started it all, there were plenty of surprises and heartbreaks to plant this season on our binge watch list.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through South Carolina, where we stop in Clemson, Travelers Rest and Charleston!!

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: On this show we highlight some of the best diving in the lower Keys. From the wreck of the Vandenberg too the beautiful reefs in Key West, this show has it all.

programme.title: Dirty 30
programme.desc: Dirty 30 is a groundbreaking docu-series filmed, edited, and directed by Eric Guarino. In this first episode, we follow Mike Iaconelli to the Bassmaster Elite Series on the iconic St. Johns River. As the camera rolls, we dive deep into the fishing world, shedding light on the industry and exploring the untold stories from Ike’s incredible 30-year career on the road.From behind-the-scenes moments to raw, unfiltered insights, this episode peels back the curtain on what it really takes to thrive in professional fishing. Get ready for some dirt, real talk, BIG FISH, and an up-close look at one of the sport’s most legendary figures.Folks at home,Celebrating 30 years in professional bass fishing is an incredible journey, and it wouldn’t be possible without you, the fans. Bass fishing professionally is really all about the fans, and I just want to say how much I appreciate every single one of you. I hope you enjoy the show!NEVER GIVE UP!!! — Ike

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: We sent Jay to the shark bite capital OF THE WORLD, it just so happens to be in our backyard. Watch Jay get shark bit in the scariest episode yet.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle explores the Great Lakes on his Sea-Doo in search of walleye and lake trout.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself on an island in the heart of St. Joseph’s Bay on Black’s Island in search of fish, food and a good time

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In Episode 10 Boat Trader heads to central Texas to explore boating culture in the lone star state. Second only to Alaska in size, Texas is known as the place where everything is bigger. From big college football games to endless oil fields and vast wind farms, Texas is home to more than 30 million Americans. But the state is about more than just big oil, college football and cattle farms - it's also home to some of the best boating in the country. Boasting a myriad of waterways, boaters here enjoy hundreds of lakes, rivers and streams that provide recreational opportunities, abundant wildlife and plenty of fishing. From Austin Texas to San Antonio host Ryan McVinney and the Boat Trader crew explore the laid-back Texas lake life including boat up restaurants along the Colorado River, watersports in Austin and the history of the waterways throughout the region. Boat manufacturers highlighted in this episode are Tige Boats and ATX Surf Boats, two premium Texas-based wake boat brands known for their high-quality, cutting-edge vessels that come equipped with advanced wake shaping technologies and equipment ideal for water skiing, wake surfing and wakeboarding. There's even a wake surfing dog!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledge—and point the way to the future."

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and his wife Anna celebrate the first day of summer by taking their daughters out for a fun-filled day on the water.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interlux’s paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team highlighted deck repair and antique motor restoration, including storage solutions and structural enhancements.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slade’s dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing………. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home décor.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Notoriously nocturnal and living in some of the densest cover imaginable, the black-tailed deer is generally known to be more ghostly than the most challenging old whitetails.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Texas isn’t all mesquite flats, corn feeders, and wire fences. Some of the most extreme terrain in the country can be found in the Lone Star State, and it just so happens that hunting opportunities abound for the adventurous.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has made more daylight appearances than possibly any mature bucks in existence. Now that Slade is back from the midwest The chase is on.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's May of 2022 and Mark Peterson is waterfowl hunting in Argentina. A year has passed since Mark conquered the North America Waterfowl Slam. During the off-season, and with Covid just a memory, his focus shifted to thoughts of South America and the waterfowl species that it holds. After a few months of research and talking with the experts at Worldwide Trophy Adventures, he laid out the plan to attempt the South America slam in 2022. With 20 species on the list, Mark is now hunting ducks below the equator as they migrate North to warmer weather. Enjoy this first installment of a 9 episode series that showcases his new quest for another single-season waterfowl slam.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!
